families.name: Indigenous of Piratininga
history: On this page, we list indigenous people that lived in Piratininga and are descendant of Tibiriçá.

people.name: Tibiriçá / Martim Afonso
history:
The first registers about Tibiriçá were made by Pero Lopes de Sousa in his diary. Among the citations we reinforce the relationship with João Ramalho and Piratininga (Diário de Navegação, de Martim Afonso de Sousa, 1927, pp. 407, 411). In your "Memórias para a História da Capitania de São Vicente", Gaspar Madre de Deus names him "Tebireçá" and also lists his leadearship positions and his Christian name:
  • "Senhor dos Campos de Piratininga" (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 2010, pp. 41)
  • His Christian name "Martim Afonso Tebiriçá" (Madre de Deus Gaspar, Frei, . 2010, pp. 84, 104)
  • An infant "Príncipe" (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 2010, pp. 90)

The relationship between Tibiriçá with the church was excellent, the Priest Saint José de Anchieta informs us that "nosso principal, grande amigo e protetor Martim Afonso" (Anchieta, José de, Santo, 1933, pp. 187) when Piratininga was under attack, but we cannot hide the wrong vision about American Indigenous few lines after these graceful words when he reports that Tibiriçá has "... tanta madureza que não parecia homem do Brasil."(Anchieta, José de, Santo, 1933, pp. 187). In this document, the Priest Saint also reports that Tibiriçá died in the year 1562.

marriages.name: Not Known
history: Let us suppose that genealogists are correct, so a research not finalized is showing her mitocondrial haplogroup C1b (Sillos, Luiz, 2023, t. 01:07:10).

children.name: Beatriz Dias
history: According to genealogists (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 443; Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume IX, pp. 67).

children.name: Terebé / Maria
history: A hypothesis that was part of a novel according to Priest Serafim Leite (Projeto Compartilhar, "Pedro Dias").

people.name: Beatriz Dias
history: After studying documents that also had part of João Ramalho's testament (W. Luiz, 1904, pp. 564), the genealogist Luiz G. Silva Leme changed his initial conclusion, that she was João Ramalho's daughter (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 443; Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume IX, pp. 67), but there is not any primary source that allows us to reach confirm this relationship.
A research not finalized is showing that her mitocondrial haplogroup is C1b (subgroup) (Sillos, Luiz, 2023, t. 01:07:10).

marriages.name: Lopo Dias
history: Cited for her daughter during Priest José de Anchieta's canonization documents (Viotti, Hélio A., 1996, 23) and for her son in his inventory (Inventários e Testamento 2, 1920, pp. 113).
For more details about their children click on the husband's link.

people.name: Terebé / Maria da Grã
history: It was not possible to find a primary source citing her, but Américo de Moura informs that Pedro Taques reports her marriage with the Portuguese Pedro Dias (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 347), this narrative was followed by Luiz G. Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume VII, pp. 03). The Priest Serafim Leite (Projeto Compartilhar, "Pedro Dias"), and H. V. Castro Coelho (Castro Coelho, H. V., ASBRAP 18, pp. 93-94) show another possibility.

marriages.name: Pedro Dias
history: According to Luiz G. Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume VII, pp. 03).

families.name: Indigenous of Ururay
history: On this section it is listed people hat lived near of Ururay when Martim Afonso de Sousa arrived.

people.name: Piqueroby
history: In opposition to his brother, Tibiriçá, that was not aligned with the church and colonizers, Piqueroby made a war against them (Kok, Glória, 2009, pp. 2), probably, as a side effect of his actions, there is not any documentation citing him explicitly.

The first reference to his name appears in 17th century through memories of Priest Jorge Moreira (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 1840, pp. 441). In the footnotes present in "Cartas Jesuíticas", that was published in 1933, the editors showed different personal names to Piqueroby that other authors used (Anchieta, José de, Santo, 1933, pp. 183, 195).

The actions of Piqueroby, and other inhabitants, in the war years are described in works like of Glória Kok (Kok, Glória, 2009), inside this work, there is a description that his brother-in-law João Ramalho was refusing to obey war orders, he received threat of arrest and exile (Atas, Volume I, pp. 15; Kok, Glória, 2009, pp. 3), but the war was not against his brother-in-law, as it was explained by Beatriz Perrone-Moisés and Renato Sztutman, the war moved to opposite sides cousins, and brothers. As a final act, there was a massacre against Indigenous people (Perrone-Moisés, Beatriz, and Sztutman, Renato, 2010).

marriages.name: Not Known
history: Let us suppose that genealogists are correct, so a research not finalized is showing her mitocondrial haplogroup A2-T16111C (Sillos, Luiz, 2023, t. 00:40:52).

children.name: Antonia Rodrigues
history: According to Priest Jorge Moreira's memories (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 1840, pp. 441 ; de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 443; Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume IX, pp. 67).

people.name: Antonia Rodrigues
history: We only know something about her, because the Priest Jorge Moreira wrote some memories (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 1840, pp. 441 ; de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 443; Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume IX, pp. 67).
A research in progress is showning she has a mitocondrial haplogroup A2-T16111C (Sillos, Luiz, 2023, t. 00:40:52).
Her generation is listed in his husband's family.

marriages.name: António Rodrigues
history: According to Priest Jorge Moreira's memories (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 1840, pp. 441 ; de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 443; Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume IX, pp. 67).
